message.entry: Block ''{0}'' does not fully set the dimensions of output {1}.

Inconsistent numeric values for output signal ''{0}'' in Stateflow chart ''{1}''. Minimum value ({2}) specified in ''Limit Range'' is out of Data Type Range [{3} , {4}].
Port width mismatch. Chart is expecting input events signal of length {0}. The actual input events signal has length {1}.\n{2}
Port width mismatch. Output ''{0}'' expects a signal of size {1}.
Port width mismatch. Input ''{0}'' expects a signal of size {1}. The signal received is of size {2}.\n{3}
Failed to resolve data ''{0}'' in ''{1}'' to a valid Simulink.Signal object.
Unable to modify parameter {0} of ''{1}'' while model is simulating. To use the new value, restart the simulation.
Unable to modify parameter {0} of ''{1}'' when model is initialized in Fast Restart. To use the new value, disable Fast Restart.
This output port is being mapped to a container output of size {0}.

Error evaluating {0} parameter data ''{1}'' in its parent workspace.
Invalid setting for the initial value of the Simulink signal object specified for the data object ''{0}''.
Invalid setting in ''{0}'' for parameter ''{1}''

Input port ''{0}'' is fed by a multiplexed signal that contains at least one variable-size element. This is not supported. Demultiplex the signal and feed individual elements to the block. Or, convert this signal into a non-virtual bus by specifying a bus object.
Unable to save operating point because block ''{0}'' contains state variables that are not compatible with simulation state save and restore.

Unable to determine unified dimensions for the multiplexed signal at input ''{0}'' in subsystem ''{1}'' because one or more of the input signals is of matrix type. Specifically, the dimensions '{'{2}'}' cannot be unified. Consequently, signal dimension information cannot be propagated beyond input ''{3}''.
An error occurred while propagating {0} through ''{1}''.

Cannot propagate frame-based signal through input ''{0}'' because this input expects a sample-based signal. The frame-based signal originates from ''{1}''. Consider inserting an Unbuffer block in the signal path.
Error in port widths or dimensions. Invalid dimension has been specified for input ''{0}''.
Data type mismatch. Input ''{0}'' expects a signal of {1}. However, it is driven by a signal of {2}.
Output ''{0}'' of the atomic subchart cannot have an inherited type
Data type mismatch. Output ''{0}'' of chart ''{1}'' is mapped to an atomic subchart output of a different type.
Unable to assign structure value to non-structure output ''{0}'' of chart ''{1}''.
Output bus ''{0}'' of chart ''{1}'' is mapped to a nonvirtual output bus in a Simulink based state.
Data type mismatch. Output ''{0}'' is a signal of {1}. However, it is driving a signal of {2}.
Complex signal mismatch. Input ''{0}'' expects a signal of {1}. However, it is driven by a signal of {2}.
Complex signal mismatch. Output ''{0}'' is a signal of {1}. However, it is driving a signal of {2}.
''{0}'' derives its data type from a bus, which is not supported for input or output data.
Cannot initialize dimensions of ''{0}'' of ''{1}'' to {2}. When the number of dimensions of a matrix exceeds 2, the size of the trailing dimension must be greater than 1.
Error evaluating properties of {0} object ''{1}'' in {2} ''{3}'' (used by block ''{4}'')

String signal from output data ''{0}'' of chart ''{1}'' truncated at time step ''{2}''. Length of string exceeds the upper limit of ''{3}'' characters. To fix the problem, increase the upper limit of characters in the string type definition.

Placing the Stateflow chart ''{0}'' inside a subsystem that contains a "For Each" block is not supported because of one of these reasons: 1. The chart has a data with scope "Data Store Memory". 2. The chart exports functions. 3. The chart calls exported functions or Simulink functions from outside this chart. 4. The chart uses messages.

The {0} ''{1}'' is unable to be placed inside a subsystem containing a "For Each" block. This might be because of one or more of the following reasons: 1. The {0} has a data with scope "Data Store Memory". 2. The {0} calls Simulink functions.
Hidden 'Signal Conversion' block insertion before this input port. The hidden block parameter 'Output' is set to 'Nonvirtual bus'. Consider manually inserting such a block to debug the problem.
<sldiag objui="outport" objparam="{0}" objname="{1}">Output port {0}</sldiag> of ''{1}'' cannot have mixed data type. Output ports of Simulink functions in Stateflow need to have a unique data type.

''{0}'' is unable to convert parameter ''{1}'' from data type ''{2}'' to data type ''{3}'' because conversion of parameters with enumerated data types is not supported.\n\nThis could be caused by leaving the initial value field of this data empty. For local data of enum type which are mapped to atomic subchart DSMs, a non-empty initial value with the correct enumeration type needs to be specified.

The output port ''{0}'' inside the function call subsystem ''{1}'' has discontiguous memory. This can happen for instance when the output port is connected to a Bus Creator block which outputs a virtual bus or to a Mux block. Such output ports cannot be used in Function call subsystems which lie inside a Stateflow chart. To correct this, please insert an explicit "Signal Conversion" block before the output port to convert it into a contiguous signal.

Data Store Memory block with name ''{0}'' was not found for chart ''{1}''. <actions exclusiveFixIts="yes"> <action type="fixit"> <cmd>slprivate(''createMissingDataStore_cb'', ''missingDataStoreWithBlock'',''{0}'',''{2}'')</cmd> <txt>Create Data Store</txt> </action> </actions>
The type ''{0}'' of parameter {1} of {2} is not supported.

Invalid connection from <sldiag objui="outport" objparam="{0}" objname="{1}">output port {0}</sldiag> of ''{1}'' to <sldiag objui="inport" objparam="{2}" objname="{3}">input port {2}</sldiag> of ''{3}''. Ports are not compatible and cannot be connected to each other.
Invalid mapping from <sldiag objui="outport" objparam="{0}" objname="{1}">output port {0}</sldiag> of ''{1}'' to symbol ''{2}'' of ''{3}''.
Invalid message connection. Message output ''{0}'' in chart ''{1}'' must connect to an input port that accepts messages.
Invalid message connection. Message input ''{0}'' in chart ''{1}'' must connect to an output port that produces messages.

Derivative of continuous data ''{0}'' in chart ''{1}'' is not finite at time {2}. The simulation will be stopped. There may be a singularity in the solution. If not, try reducing the step size (either by reducing the fixed step size or by tightening the error tolerances)

Potential conflicting usages of identifier ''{0}'': The name of the signal connected to <sldiag objui="outport" objparam="{1}" objname="{2}">output port {1}</sldiag> of the block {2} and the name of the signal connected to <sldiag objui="outport" objparam="{3}" objname="{4}">output port {3}</sldiag> of the block {4} appear to be the same
Invalid message connection for output message ''{0}'' of ''{1}''. Message connections may not be branched and provided to multiple destinations.
Unable to map parameter ''{0}'' in ''{1}'' to a run-time parameter. This parameter is an unsupported variable class such as a string, structure, cell, or an unsupported data type.
Variable-size data ''{0}'' is not supported in an atomic subchart.
''{0}'' has sample time ''{1}''. Only inherited (-1) sample times are allowed in triggered subsystem ''{2}''.
Sample time {0} of ''{1}'' does not match the sample time {2} of the Simulink based state ''{3}'' controlling its execution.

Invalid data attributes set for local queue ''{0}'' of the "{1}" block. Local priority queues require real scalar message data of type double, single, int8, uint8, int16, uint16, int32, uint32, or boolean.

Unable to set data type ''{0}'' for input or output of block ''{1}''. Signals of type ''{0}'' must be scalar, non-complex, and fixed-size. Additionally, continuous sample times are not supported for these signals.
Data ''{0}'' has size {1} and does not match the dimensions of the input port in a Simulink based state.
The dimensions of input port {0} in Simulink based state ''{1}'' do not match the size of the input data.
In atomic subchart {0}, symbol {1} maps to a chart symbol with a different structure type.
Block ''{0}'' outputs {1} for element {2} of {3} at time {4}. <actions exclusiveFixIts="no"> <action type="suppression"></action> </actions>
